definition: to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: The assumption of an ever-increasing standard of living is no longer taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 生活标准会持续增长的设想也不再是想当然的了。

sentences.english: We must not act on assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能凭想当然办事。

sentences.english: We all take tying for granted.
And above all perhaps, taking nothing for granted.
sentences.chinese: 也许最重要的是，不要一切想当然。

sentences.english: They simply think science is too difficult for lower-grade students younger than ten years old.
sentences.chinese: 他们想当然地认为科学对不足10岁的儿童太难了。

sentences.english: It is natural for every man to think himself of importance. (No. 27)
sentences.chinese: 每个人都想当然地认为自己最重要。

sentences.english: United fans have come to take for granted that van der Sar will save the day.
sentences.chinese: 曼联球迷都想当然地认为范德萨能够转危为安。

sentences.english: He observe things very carefully and never take any thing for granted.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细观察事物，对任何事情从不想当然。

sentences.english: But since it is here we pretty well take it for granted.
sentences.chinese: 但既然生活在这个时代，我们不免会想当然。

sentences.english: And yet you should not think of China as particularly well-integrated with its neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 但是请不要想当然地认为中国和其邻国是密切联系的。

sentences.english: So think about these things, don't pass over these details lightly, and don't take them for granted.
sentences.chinese: 我们不应该轻易忽略细节，也不要想当然。

sentences.english: He is a provocative man who takes nothing whatever for granted.
sentences.chinese: 他是位爱争论的人，无论休整都不愿想当然。

sentences.english: Don't take your life for granted. Don't neglect it either.
sentences.chinese: 既不要想当然地对待你的生活，也不要忽视它的存在。

sentences.english: But don't be lolled into thinking we'll get of easy this year.
sentences.chinese: 但是千万不要想当然认为，今年的情况会好一点。

sentences.english: People take it for granted that fatties are born to make slender people look good.
sentences.chinese: 人们想当然的认为胖子就是给美女做陪衬的。

sentences.english: Surely ecological concerns would be foremost in park decision making.
sentences.chinese: 我想当然地认为，在公园决策中，生态因素主导一切。

definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
